Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      The default constructor for a Board which instantiates an NQxNQ String[][] and fills the board with empty spaces.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addQueens(int r, int c, java.util.LinkedList<Queen> QP)
      The recursive algorithm which iterates over the Board, searching for safe places to addQueens
      boolean equals(Board other)
      A helper method which verifies if one Board is the same as another
      java.lang.String getPiece(int r, int c)
      A getter method which returns the piece at a location
      boolean isQueen(int r, int c)
      A helper method which verifies if a Queen is placed at the given coordinates of the Board.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      void setQueen(Queen q)
      A setter method which changes the value of a position on the Board according to the Queen
      boolean solve(int startR, int startC)
      The wrapper method for recursive calls to addQueens() which instantiates an empty list of placed Queens.
      java.lang.String toString()
      The toString method which displays a Board in the console as "X"s and "Q"s

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        The default constructor for a Board which instantiates an NQxNQ String[][] and fills the board with empty spaces.

    • Method Detail

      • solve

        public boolean solve(int startR,
                     int startC)
        The wrapper method for recursive calls to addQueens() which instantiates an empty list of placed Queens.
        Parameters:
        startR - the row to begin searching from
        startC - the column to being searching from
        Returns:
        true if a solution was found

      • addQueens

        public boolean addQueens(int r,
                         int c,
                         java.util.LinkedList<Queen> QP)
        The recursive algorithm which iterates over the Board, searching for safe places to addQueens
        Parameters:
        r - the row to start from
        c - the column to begin searching from
        QP - a LinkedList of Queens placed so far
        Returns:
        true if NQ queens were placed, false if fewer Queens were able to be placed

      • isQueen

        public boolean isQueen(int r,
                       int c)
        A helper method which verifies if a Queen is placed at the given coordinates of the Board.
        Parameters:
        r - the row to check
        c - the column to check
        Returns:
        true if a Queen is placed at b[r][c], false if not

      • getPiece

        public java.lang.String getPiece(int r,
                                 int c)
        A getter method which returns the piece at a location
        Parameters:
        r - the row to fetch
        c - the column to fetch
        Returns:
        the String value of the piece at that location: "Q" if Queen, " " if not

      • setQueen

        public void setQueen(Queen q)
        A setter method which changes the value of a position on the Board according to the Queen
        Parameters:
        q - the Queen to be "copied" to the Board

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Board other)
        A helper method which verifies if one Board is the same as another
        Parameters:
        other - the Board to be compared to
        Returns:
        true if all the pieces on the Board on the same

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        The toString method which displays a Board in the console as "X"s and "Q"s
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the String representation of the Board

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
